(A) Evidence of Erosion: This system is in a constant state of erosion due to fall and spring freshets.
(B) Particulars of Scouring: Yes, caused by debris build ups at high water times.
(C) Water levels: Water levels for pink spawning were stable and the supply was adequate this year.
(D) Spawning distribution: Pinks were distributed over the lower 5 km.
(E) Comments on predators: This system supports a large number of black bears.
(G) New obstructions: Obstructions in lower areas below highway bridge create flood channels and rearing areas which dry in summer, killing fry.
(I) Habitat change: Log jam under hydro transmission line removed in Sept. New garbage dump is situated adjacent to an estuary feeder stream.
(K) Additional comments: Campsite expansion at mouth will increase angler days and have an effect on the estuary as well. System in need of more resources to enumerate and protect the coho returns.
